instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0.47A 20V no boot
threads.message:
CPU gets hot, no USB activity, and no caps lock light.

EFI?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0.47A 20V no boot
threads.message:
Is worth to try known good BIOS.
Any history available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0.47A 20V no boot
threads.message:
No visible damage, no visible corrosion
I tried another EFI chip same behaviour

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0.47A 20V no boot
threads.message:
Monitor volttage at L7210/20.
Can you note any change in the first 10-15s?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0.47A 20V no boot
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0.47A 20V no boot
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0.47A 20V no boot
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0.47A 20V no boot
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R1320</RESISTOR>-25 resistors.
Compare diode mode and DC levels with good board.
An o-scope can help you to check the real activity there; pay atention to <SIGNAL>LPC_FRAME_L</SIGNAL>.
